availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Wall (Owensboro, Kentucky, attorney and major in 17th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Owensboro, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Eleanora Wall. County courthouse clerk in Owensboro in 1850. Attorney in Owensboro in 1860. Major of the 17th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from January 1, 1862, to April 15, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, Owensboro, p. 352A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, Owensboro, p. 967.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 307, 373.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Daviess County Administration Bonds, 1834-2868; Vol 1-4, p. 786 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com on December 17, 2020).
Find A Grave, "William B. Wall (1822-1866)," Memorial #126732542, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126732542 (accessed December 17, 2020).
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #124475, Certificate #80635.
"The Bench and Bar of the City of Owensboro," Messenger-Inquirer (Owensboro, KY), January 29, 1899, p. 19.
